directions:
Put the dried fruit, zests and juice,
alcohol, butter and sugar in a large pan
set over a medium heat. Bring to the
boil, then lower the heat and simmer for
5 mins. Tip the fruit mixture into a large
bowl and leave to cool for 30 mins.

Heat oven to 150C/130C fan/gasLine a deep 20cm cake tin with a double
layer of baking parchment, then wrap
a double layer of newspaper around the
outside – tie with string to secure.

Add the remaining ingredients to the
fruit mixture and stir well, making sure
there are no pockets of flour. Tip into
your prepared tin, level the top with a
spatula and bake in the centre of the
oven for 2 hrs.

Remove the cake from the oven, poke
holes in it with a skewer and spoon over
2 tbsp of your chosen alcohol. Leave the
cake to cool completely in the tin.

To store, peel off the baking parchment,
then wrap well in cling film. Feed the
cake with 1-2 tbsp alcohol every
fortnight, until you ice it. Don’t feed the
cake for the final week to give the
surface a chance to dry before icing.
ingredients: 1kg mixed dried fruits (use a mix of raisins, sultanas, currants, cherries, cranberries, prunes or figs)
150ml brandy, Sherry, whisky or rum, plus extra for feeding
title: Make & mature Christmas cake
